body: How to reproduce it? I mean that case looks quite artificial.

Thanks for posting in our issue tracker.
In order to properly assist you, we need additional information:

- When does the issue occur?
- What do you see?
- What was the expected result?
- Can you supply us with a stacktrace? (optional)
- Do you have exact code to reproduce it? Maybe a PHPUnit tests that fails? (optional)

Thanks!

_This is an automated comment, triggered by adding the label `status:need more info`._
and may be additional need add 'safe' rules

> What is the expected result?
> load value to '' attribute 

There's no such attribute and won't ever be...
Yes, technically it's correct but it doesn't make sense.
I try to use it as "boundary case" in test, for example
OK. That makes sense to fix it but it's not a priority.

issue.title: Empty fields exclusion in safe attributes of Model

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | ✔️
| New feature?  | ❌
| Breaks BC?    | ❌
| Fixed issues  | #15557 

This change will exclude empty fields like `['' => 'value']` from safe attributes.
